document.h2:
Static leases
This section is not available when the device is switched to bridged mode.
document.p: By default, each device will get an IP address from the 's DHCP server. When a device leaves, is turned off or the lease time of the address has expired, the IP address becomes available and can be re-used for other devices.

When you want to run a service on a network device (for example, a web server, network printer, etc.), it is advised to assign a reserved IP to the device. This way, the device will always be reachable on the same address and there is no risk that you are accessing the wrong device.
The Static leases section on the Local Network page allows to manage your static leases.
